intro: Jacobaea erucifolia subsp. grandidentata, commonly known as the grandidentate ragwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its yellowish-green flowers and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a distinctive, serrated margin. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its toxic properties due to the presence of pyrrolizidinal alkaloids.
